The surf.resource Module¶

class surf.resource.Resource(subject, block_outo_load=False)¶

The Resource class, represents the transparent proxy object that exposes sets of RDF triples under the form of <s,p,o> and <s’,p,s> as an object in python, one can create resource directly by instantiating this class, but it is advisable to use the session to do so, as the session will create subclasses of Resource based on the subjects rdf:type

classmethod all(offset=None, limit=None)¶
retrieves all (or just a limited number from the specified offset) resources that are of the specified type as the resource class
classmethod concept(subject, store=None)¶
returns the Resources Concept uri (type)
classmethod get_by(*objects, **symbols)¶
retrieves all resources that have attribute value pairs as specified
classmethod get_by_attribute(*attributes)¶
retrieves all resources from the data store that have the specified attributes and have the type of the class
classmethod get_like(*objects, **symbols)¶
retrieves all resources that have attribute value pairs, with support for regex matching on values, currently reges is slow, try to avoid
graph(direct=True)¶
returns an RDFLib ConjunctiveGraph represenation of the current resource
classmethod instance(subject)¶
returns the Resource instance currently in memory with the specified subject
classmethod instances()¶
returns all the instances of type Resource currently available in memory
is_dirty()¶
True if the resource has been modified during runtime and not persisted, False otherwise
is_present()¶
returns True if the resource is present in the Store or False otherwise
load()¶
loads all attributes from the data store, both direct attributes (where the subject is the subject of the resource) and indirect attributes (where the object is the subject of the resource)
load_from_source(data=None, file=None, location=None, format=None)¶
load the resource from a source (uri, file or string rdf data)
classmethod namespace()¶
returns the namespace of the Resources type
remove()¶
remove the resource from the store
save()¶
saves the resource to the data store, replacing the representation with the current one
serialize(format='xml', direct=False)¶
returns a serialized version of the internal graph represenatation of the resource, the format is the same as expected by rdflib’s graph serialize method
set(graph)¶
sets a resource from the supplied graph
subject¶
the namespaces
update()¶
update the resource in the store, does not remove other triples related to it
